attributes.name: StepManager
attributes.description:
A component for creating a set of "steps", where only one is visible at a time

{{#step-manager as |w|}}
  {{#w.step}}
    The first step
  {{/w.step}}

  {{#w.step}}
    The second step
  {{/w.step}}

  <button {{action w.transition-to-next}}>
    Next Step
  </button>
{{/step-manager}}

fields.name: _wasActive
fields.description: Used internally to track the "active" state of the last time the attributes were updated.

fields.name: name the name for this step
fields.description: Name used to transition to this step

fields.name: isActive
fields.description: Whether this state is currently the active one

fields.name: hasInactiveState
fields.description: Whether or not an inactive state should be displayed instead of hiding the step entirely when not visible

fields.name: _hasRendered
fields.description:
Whether the initial render cycle has completed

Used to prevent a double-render-cycle when yielding an array of steps

fields.name: _lastStep
fields.description: Used internally to track the previous step

fields.name: currentStep the current active step
fields.description:
The currentStep property can be used for providing, or binding to, the name of the current step.

If you only want to provide the initial step, but do not want the target object's value to be bound to it, you can either:

  • Pass it a value directly, like currentStep='name'
  • Use the Unbound helper, like currentStep=(unbound nameOfStep)

If you want to bind the value in both directions, you can do so by:

  • Passing a template value directly, like `currentStep=nameOfStep
  • Using the Mut helper, like currentStep=(mut nameOfStep)

Providing a mutable value is useful for cases like binding the current step name to a query param.

methods.name: doTransition
methods.description: Used internally to transition to a specific named step

params.name: to
params.description: the name of the step to transition to

params.name: from
params.description: the name of the step being transitioned

methods.name: register-step-component
methods.description:
Register a step with the manager

Adds a set to the internal registry of steps by name. If no name is provided, a name will be assigned by index.

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the step being registered

methods.name: transition-to
methods.description:
Transition to a named step

If the currentStep property was provided as a mutable value, like:

{{#step-manager currentStep=(mut step) as |w|}}
  ...
{{/step-manager}}

Then the external property will be updated to the new step name.

params.name: to
params.description: the name of the step to transition to

params.name: value
params.description: the value to pass to the transition actions

methods.name: transition-to-next
methods.description:
Transition to the "next" step

When called, this action will advance from the current step to the next one, as defined by the order of their insertion into the DOM (AKA, the order in the template).

methods.name: transition-to-previous
methods.description:
Transition to the "previous" step

When called, this action will go back to the previous step according to the step which was visited before entering the currentStep

yields.name: w.currentStep
yields.description: The name of the current step

yields.name: w.steps
yields.description: All of the step names that are currently defined, in order
